We may say at once that the volume is most interesüng and should prove of great value to the future South-African bistory in dealing with the many stirring events which bave taken place during the period it corers. rest and worthy the study of all, who wish to know the ins and outs of the intricate Transvaal questions. (South Afriean Review). KINADRUPPELS van Dr. DE VRIJ. Cacao fabrikanten, KOOG a. d. ZAAN, HOLLAND. Dr. E. J. P. JORISSEN. Transvaalsche Herinneringen, 1876-'96. To all who are interested ia the inner history of South-African questions, this lit Ie volume should prove exceedingly welcome. This testimony is of value, and we believe it to be bot accurate and sincere. It seems a pity that a book containing so much that is of interest to Engii hmen, should not be published in English. (Manchester Guardian).
